keyword: how many calories in one ear of corn
title: How Many Calories in One Ear of Corn?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in one ear of corn, including carbs, protein, fiber, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with easy tweaks.
h1: How Many Calories in One Ear of Corn?
assumptions: Medium ear of corn (~90g edible kernels), boiled or steamed, no added butter, salt, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by corn variety, size, freshness, cooking method, and additions like butter. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium ear of corn provides ~90 kcal and ~19 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Grilled with 1 tsp oil per ear

faqs.q: How many calories in one ear of corn on the cob?
faqs.a: About 90 kcal for a medium plain ear.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one ear of corn?
faqs.a: Roughly 19 g total carbs, including 2.7 g fiber and 6.3 g sugars.
No, one ear has ~3.4 g protein; it's more carb-focused.

faqs.q: How does butter affect calories in corn?
faqs.a: 1 tbsp butter adds ~100 kcal, making a buttered ear ~190 kcal.

faqs.q: Does cooking method change calories in corn?
faqs.a: Minimal change for plain corn, but grilling with oil adds ~40 kcal per tsp.
